Credit Officer - Store Network

Company Name Genuine Parts Company Company Location Rowville, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 20 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

The Role

To contribute to the profitability, growth and return on investment of GPC Asia Pacific Pty Ltd by reducing outstanding debts and maintaining accurate customer accounts by liaising with external customers to achieve these goals; whilst adhering to relevant statutory legislation and company policies and procedures.

\xa0

Key roles and responsibilities for this position consist of but are not limited to:

\xa0

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Debt Collection

  • Identify outstanding accounts
  • Contact Customers/Stores and investigate reasons for late payments and payment options
  • Provide customers with delivery receipts as required
  • Regularly communicate with Store Network/Customers regarding their outstanding accounts and raise and lower credit limits of customers as required
  • Negotiate a payment plan for Customers
  • Seek authorisation for payment plan from Store Network Team Leader
  • Place accounts on stop credit as required
  • Check and investigate disputes or discrepancies for customer accounts

\xa0

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Account Maintenance

  • Act as a focal point for the Store Network regarding account maintenance and set up
  • Set Credit limits for Customers according to internal policies and procedures
  • Ensure appropriate security to minimize risk
  • Update and maintain Account Information on systems and ensure account set up is correct

\xa0

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Reconciliations

  • Ensure all Key Accounts are reconciled
  • Report Key Account reconciliation Statistics to Store Network Credit Team Leader
  • Use of IT tools for efficient reconciliations

\xa0

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Receipting

  • Receive cheques and Prepare cheques to be banked into company’s account
  • Allocate all Debtor payments to mainframe system

\xa0

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Customer Service

  • Take phone calls from Customers and the Store Network and Resolve queries
  • Handle customer complaints
  • Process journals to resolve banking/receipting issues

\xa0

To be successful in this role you will need to demonstrate the following:

\xa0

  • Minimum 2 years’ experience in Credit control.
  • Demonstrated ability to relate with customers and fellow employees
  • Good customer service skills, oral and written communication skills
  • Intermediate mathematical and literacy skills
  • Intermediate PC and application skills including Access, Excel, Word.

Your environment

Genuine Parts Company (GPC) is the Global Leader in automotive aftermarket parts sales and distribution, encompassing a number of significant international businesses in USA, Canada, Australia and New Zealand. Our Asia Pacific businesses include Ashdown-Ingram, McLeod Accessories, Motospecs, RDA Brakes and our iconic brand Repco.


Apply Now
To make an application, please click the 'Apply Now' button below.

Please note only short-listed candidates will be contacted.

GPC Asia Pacific is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Senior Pricing Analyst

Company Name StarTrack Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 20 hours ago Number of views 10 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Summary

Generate commercial outcomes and pricing change in a fast paced and complex working environment!

Overview

Who we are:

Every day we deliver a premium service to our customers, but we don’t stop there. We have an unrivalled network, an 11,000 team comprising 134 nationalities both male and female who all share common values that drive our shared desire to make a difference for customers. Our passion for people means we’re always looking to grow our team, and provide even greater experiences for our employees

The Role

You will work with stakeholders across functions to articulate the value proposition and quantify overarching commercial benefits whilst proactively and collaboratively leading customised transactional pricing opportunities (business as usual).. The role will see you involved in assignments of greater scope and complexity than a BA and may also take on a people leader accountability.

Requirements
  • Price modelling and product portfolio analysis focussed on winning new business and client retention that is sustainable
  • Pricing for large tenders and providing commercial insight and recommendations to drive decision making
  • Create and develop pricing methodology that aligns with StarTrack strategy and market trends
  • Influence and support stakeholders across StarTrack and the broader Australia Post Group, working closely with Sales and Product teams
  • Review and recommend commercial terms for contracts, understanding risk exposure
  • Enabler of continuous improvement, striving to improve internal efficiencies and turn-around times in responding to pricing requests
  • Drive commercial behaviour that's aligned to StarTrack goals without giving rise to unintended risk


What You’ll Need
  • Extensive experience in a commercially focussed Analyst role
  • Proven track record of achieving successful commercial outcomes and pricing change in fast paced, complex working environments
  • Advanced Excel expertise and a confident user of BI tools
  • Experience with working on large and complex data sets
  • Strong communication skills and an intuitive ability to unravel complex matters into clear messaging for stakeholders to understand
  • Knowledge and application of value based pricing in competitive markets, understanding the value proposition

If you’re ready to put our customers first, we’d love to talk to you. At StarTrack, we’re focused on people, on teamwork and on helping you get the job done. Since joining forces with Australia Post, StarTrack are stronger than ever before, and can now offer both business and consumer markets an unrivalled range of parcel, freight, express, courier and international solutions – all under one banner.

Our new combined business brings the trust, reach and convenience that Australia Post is known for, together with the premium service standards of standards of StarTrack, to create the largest parcels, freight logistics provider in the country. And as the largest logistics provider in the country, we know a thing or two about delivery.

We are committed to being an equal opportunity employer with a diverse workforce.

Ready to take the next step in your career?

Get started by registering your interest today!

Enquiries: askrecruitment@startrack.com.au

Associate

  • Logistics and Supply Chain

Risk Manager

Company Name Lander & Rogers Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 20 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Lander & Rogers is a leading independent Australian law firm operating nationally from Melbourne, Sydney and Brisbane. We are proud to be the trusted advisor to many publicly listed and private Australian companies, Australian subsidiaries of global companies as well as all levels of government.

We have nearly 500 staff nationally, seven broad areas of practice, and we cover a range of industry sectors, with a focus on financial services, insurance, government, infrastructure, real estate and retail and supply chain.

Our firm believes that legal services are much more than just the law - they are about great people, sustained excellence and exceptional client service. We have a reputation in the legal market as a provider of premium legal services, and as a sought-after employer. We are renowned in Australia for our down-to-earth and friendly workplace culture.

About The Role

We have a unique and diverse opportunity for a legally qualified Risk Manager to manage and maintain the firm’s legal excellence and risk management framework. This opportunity is unique in that you will utilise your legal skills in relation to claims management, whilst experiencing diversity and breadth through the business risk management responsibilities.

Your Key Responsibilities Will Include
  • Managing firm complaints and claims.
  • Managing all Information Barrier matters.
  • Ensuring the firm is complying with best practices in relation to Business Continuity, Disaster recovery and risk policies and procedures.
  • Proactive delivery of a strong risk and ethics education program for all staff firm-wide.
  • Creating and maintaining various compliance training registers and also any other registers required to be maintained by law.
  • Continually identifying, and mitigating new and existing firm risks, and developing solutions as part of our risk framework.
  • Working closely with the Ethics & Risk Management Committee to ensure effective communication and consistency of approach in the implementation of risk management initiatives throughout the firm.


About You

This opportunity would suit an individual who is happy to get involved in the daily management of the risk function, and can juggle this with the continuous improvement to ensure that the firm's risk management framework follows best practice. This will be a busy role with multiple competing priorities, therefore strong organisational skills as well as the ability to manage expectations is paramount. Good people and communication skills are a must have. A current practising certificate is essential as is experience in managing claims. If you have had experience in a similar role or performing parts of this role, we would be pleased to have a conversation with you.

This role presents an excellent opportunity to join a successful and growing firm with a down to earth and unique culture, with the ability to own and put your mark on the risk management function.

If you are interested, please submit your resume to Daniela Brown, People & Development Manager.

For more information about Lander & Rogers please see our website, www.landers.com.au.

Industry

  • Law Practice

Employment Type

Full-time

Job Functions

  • Finance
  • Sales

Account Executive – Enterprise

Company Name DocuSign Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 16 views

Job description

Enterprise Account Executive

Sales & Business Development | Melbourne, Australia

Change the way customers and partners live and do business while helping them grow their top and bottom line with our transformative technology.

Position Summary

We are currently seeking an Enterprise Account Executive to join DocuSign in Sydney to assist us in our journey to help everyone do business faster and better. Your chief function is to bring DocuSign to new Enterprise-level businesses and organizations within a defined geographic territory, managing deals from start to finish.

The ideal candidate will be curious by nature and possess a consistent track record of sales over-achievement in Enterprise space accounts in Sydney.

This position is an Individual Contributor and reports to the VP Sales.

Responsibilities
  • Qualify Enterprise sales opportunities based on DocuSign’s sales methodology & metrics, to include customer fit, needs/requirements and success criteria
  • Build and execute Enterprise plans for each target account
  • Effectively leverage internal resources (Senior Executives, Presales, Professional Services, Legal etc.) in Sales Campaigns to ensure sales success
  • Work effectively with your peers at DocuSign’s key partners to deliver joint value propositions for Enterprise customers
  • Develop and deliver customized sales presentations and products demonstrations, by phone/ web-demo tailored for the Enterprise customer audience.
  • Uncover Enterprise customer needs and develop relationships within the assigned accounts across all Lines of Business including IT, Procurement and Senior Management
  • Consistently seek new Enterprise business opportunities by presenting, recommending and upsell new DocuSign products, services and partner solutions
  • Accurately forecast sales activity and revenue achievement through proper use of sales tools
  • Closing lower value Enterprise sales opportunities and at the same time driving and managing larger, complex Enterprise sales deals


Basic Qualifications
  • Degree qualified
  • Willingness and ability to travel as necessary, typically about 25%.
  • Understand how to sell value and ROI into C-Level as well as sell into line of business


Preferred Qualifications
  • Proven track record of success in closing Enterprise SaaS sales opportunities from start through to completion with some of the largest customers in Sydney
  • Proven track record of success in large Enterprise space clients in Sydney
  • Proven track record of success in delivering digital value based SaaS solutions to large Enterprise space clients
  • Knowledge of one or more industry verticals is necessary – Banking, Insurance, Pharma, Life Sciences, Manufacturing, Professional Services, High Tech etc.
  • Align value based solutions with a customer’s strategic objectives

Sales & Business Development @ DocuSign

Our technology is transforming the way our customers live their lives and do business. Our Sales team is collaborating with customers across the globe to help them leverage our technology to change the way they do business. Our Business Development team is partnering with some of the largest most innovative companies in the world and in their industries to bring the power of DocuSign to more customers. Whether you are selling to an individual or a large enterprise, you will apply your extensive knowledge of our product and strategic partnerships to help our customers grow their top and bottom line.

About DocuSign

DocuSign\xae is changing how business gets done by empowering hundreds of thousands of customers and tens of millions of users in most countries around the world to sign, send and manage documents anytime, anywhere, on any device with confidence. DocuSign replaces printing, faxing, scanning and overnighting documents with the easiest, fastest, most trusted way to make every approval and decision digital. Organizations of all sizes and industries are accelerating contracts, approvals and workflows with DocuSign's Digital Transaction Management (DTM) platform and eSignature solution. DocuSign keeps life and business moving forward.

DocuSign is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Individuals seeking employment at DocuSign are considered without regards to race, ethnicity, color, age, sex, religion, national origin, ancestry, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, physical or mental disability, registered domestic partner status, caregiver status, marital status, veteran or military status, citizenship status, or any other legally protected category.

Customer Service Advisor - Keysborough

Company Name Bank of Melbourne Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 15 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Keysborough Branch
  • Permanent Full Time
  • Retail Customer Service and Sales
  • Great opportunity to kick start your Career in Banking
  • Live and work locally!
Bank of Melbourne isn't just another bank. Our Head Office and Customer Contact Centre are in the heart of Melbourne.

Our branches and corporate banking centres are staffed by the best and brightest people who will take an active role in their neighbourhood, because we believe that no one understands Victorians like the people who live here.

Our Opportunity - Customer Service Advisor

At Bank of Melbourne, we believe in taking the time to get to know our customers as a person, not a series of accounts. We're looking for people who genuinely enjoy dealing with people to be key members of our local branch customer service team.

Our Customer Service Advisors’ have a unique ability; they know how to make banking more of a conversation so customers actually look forward to coming into the branch. They know our customers' names and the neighbourhood they work in like the back of their hand, so they're always assured of a friendly face. Understanding the individual needs of both our personal and business owner customers is second nature and they're able to recommend exactly which products and services will genuinely serve them best. If more specialised advice is needed, they'll introduce customers to the local specialist best able to help.

What We Are Looking For From You

For a start, you'll love where you live and work, and enjoy creating a true sense of neighbourhood. You're at ease talking to people and know how to balance friendliness with a strong service ethic through your previous experience in sales and service. Working as part of a team is something you enjoy and you actively work with your team members to achieve performance goals. Problem-solving poses no problems, nor does thinking on your feet and adapting to change with ease.

Why this role is for you

Firstly, you want different, not traditional. You love the challenge of working in a dynamic environment where you're setting a new benchmark in customer service.

Secondly you crave development – because our customer service specialists are so critical to us there are so many opportunities for career & personal development available to them. Whether it is home lending, leadership, business banking or wealth – we have many opportunities for our people & we really want to see you grow.

Finally, you want to work with great people. You know that great people make great workplaces – we think we’ve developed a fantastic team of people and we want other fantastic people to join us.

Our commitment to you

Better banking can't be delivered without the right people. We understand that your satisfaction in what you do leads to our customers' satisfaction. We'll support and actively encourage your career development and growth, provide flexible work options and a host of some of the best financial & non-financial benefits out there.

Bank of Melbourne, as part of Westpac Group is an equal opportunity employer. As part of our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, this role is open to experienced candidates seeking a discussion around workplace flexibility.

Where to from here?

Please apply online where you will find you will be invited to participate in the first part of our online process through our assessment partner Gallup, please action this request as early as possible, to enable us to manage your application and provide you with an update on your job application in a timely manner.

For more information visit CareersatBankofMelbourne

Westpac Group is an equal opportunity employer, and we’re proud to have created a culture and work environment that values diversity and flexibility, and fosters inclusion.

CONSTRUCTION / INFRASTRUCTURE ASSOCIATES/SENIOR ASSOCIATES

MELBOURNE AND SYDNEY

Pinsent Masons LLP is a global law firm with a recognised reputation for innovation. With over 400 partners and 1500 lawyers, we support our clients across the UK, Europe, the Gulf and Asia Pacific.

In Australia, we operate exclusively as an infrastructure and energy law practice. Working closely with our international colleagues, we support our clients on some of the largest and most complex infrastructure and energy projects both in Australia and globally.

Brief

Candidates Interested In Applying Must

We are looking for passionate construction/infrastructure lawyers currently at Senior Associate or experienced Associate level to join our growing energy and infrastructure practice in Australia.
  • have relevant transactional construction and major projects experience working for a well regarded law practice in the sector or with an in house team
  • have experience on large scale construction and project finance infrastructure projects or PPP's
  • be technically excellent with strong academics
  • enjoy working in a collegiate, fast-paced, high-performing team
  • have strong written and oral communication skills
  • be admitted or eligible for admission to practice law in Australia

    The ideal candidate will be genuinely interested and committed to advancing their career in the construction, infrastructure and energy sectors. Engineering or other industry qualifications and experience will be highly regarded, as will exposure to renewable energy and PPP projects.

    In return, we offer genuine long-term career prospects, the very best national and international work, high-calibre training programmes, early responsibility and the opportunity to develop your own client relationships.
Our team in Australia

Unique to the Australian market, we have built our presence entirely around the needs of businesses in the infrastructure sector. Our infrastructure practice combines a wealth of transactional, advisory and contentious experience. The growing Australian team is currently made up of 50 plus infrastructure specialists supported by a team of 350 specialists worldwide who have helped our clients on some of the largest and most complex projects globally.

Pinsent Masons have always worked hard to develop and sustain an inclusive culture for all our people and a diverse workforce that is fully representative of all of the communities in which we live and work.

Applicants should send their CV and a short cover letter addressing the requirements set out in this role description through the Pinsent Masons Recruitment portal https://www.pinsentmasons.com/en/careers/. Candidates only, no agencies.

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 22 views

Job description


Who are we?


The Toll Group is the Asian region's leading provider of integrated logistics services, generating annual revenue of AU$8.3 billion and employing over 40,000 people across an extensive network of 1,200 sites throughout more than 50 countries across the world. We're committed to providing a safe, diverse, satisfying and fulfilling workplace for all of our people. We value integrity, trust, teamwork and being open and transparent.


The opportunity?


As part of Toll Group's new growth strategy, one of Toll's key Business Units are seeking a Compliance Coordinator based out of West Melbourne. This role is responsible for driving the proactive implementation and continual improvement of Health, Safety and Environmental culture, strategy, plan, performance and compliance.


Key accountabilities and responsibilities will include, but not be limited to:

  • Ensuring that Global Express regulatory requirements are adhered to, actioned, audited and reported on
  • Assisting in developing and implementing the necessary framework to allow and support the business in
  • Administering, monitoring, measuring, auditing and reporting on compliance with respect to our road transport obligations as stipulated in the heavy vehicle national law (HVNL), dangerous goods and workplace health and safety legislation - including Chain of Responsibility (CoR - for speed, fatigue, mass, dimension, load restraint; dangerous goods; road worthiness) and sub-contractor management - and close the feedback loop with timely escalations, as required
  • Monitoring and reviewing the incidents/infringements entered into the incident management system (IMS) on a daily basis for accuracy, completeness and compliance and liaise with the operational teams to ensure investigations and corrective actions are appropriate and timely;
  • Actively participate with the investigation of compliance related incidents and motor vehicle accidents as required;
  • Conducting and leading incident investigations (ICAM Methodology preferred)
  • With a focus on continuous improvement assist in developing and improving the information and reporting process


The ideal candidate?


As the successful candidate you will have the ability to succeed in a fast paced and pressured environment. You will be a driven individual who is analytical with great attention to detail. Veracity and the ability multi-task will be paramount in this role. You will possess superior negotiation and influencing skills, excellent communication and interpersonal skills with a strong stakeholder management focus. A background in supply chain, logistics, manufacturing or industrial environments would be highly regarded.


In return, you will be rewarded with an inclusive and dynamic team environment, a passionate company culture and the opportunity to be an integral part of Toll's new direction.


For a confidential discussion regarding the role please contact Samantha Stojcevski, Toll People, 03 9049 4003.


We will not be liable for any fees or costs associated with unsolicited CVs sent directly to line managers from recruitment agencies.

The Andrew Love Cancer Centre (ALCC) is a comprehensive cancer centre that has provided expert care to those affected by cancer in Geelong and southwest Victoria in a supportive and caring environment since 1992.

Based in Geelong, we have state-of-the-art facilities, equipment and highly skilled health professionals who provide personalised treatment and care. Strategic Account Executive

Company Name Tableau Software Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 64 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Strategic Account Executive

Department: Sales

Location(s): Melbourne, Australia

Tableau Software is a company on a mission. We help people see and understand their data. After a highly successful IPO in 2013, Tableau has become a market-defining company in the business intelligence industry. But don’t take our word for it—read what analysts like BARC and Gartner have to say about us. (Spoiler: You’ll find terms like “Leader” and “#1.”)

Tens of thousands of companies and organizations have chosen Tableau. From the executive suites of Fortune 500 companies to the jungles of Central America, from immunology research labs to high school robotics club meetings, our software can be found anywhere people have data and questions. Additionally, journalists, bloggers, and major media web sites have embraced our free product, Tableau Public, for its ability to help them share data online in the form of interactive visualizations. Check out all of our products at: www.tableau.com/product-tour .

Tableau’s culture is casual and high-energy. We are passionate about our product and our mission and we are loyal to each other and our company. We value work/life balance, efficiency, simplicity, freakishly friendly customer service, and making a difference in the world. Tableau offers exceptional professional and financial growth potential.

To learn more about Tableau’s mission, please visit: http://mission.tableau.com

Description

What you will be doing...

The Strategic Account Executive is responsible for driving sales of Tableau products within a set of Named Accounts located in an assigned geography, specifically those considered at a strategic level. The Strategic Account Executive will represent Tableau and its product suite within an assigned set of Named Accounts, exceeding sales objectives. This role will manage all aspects of the sales process including lead management, qualification, evaluation, close and account care and will play an integral role in the success of the overall sales team. This is a quota‐carrying sales position.

Some of the things you will be doing include…
  • Define and execute territory / account sales plans for the assigned geographic territory and then meet and exceed sales goals (quotas) through prospecting, qualifying, managing and closing sales opportunities within the assigned Named Strategic Accounts
  • Develop and manage sales pipeline, prospect and assess sales and move a large number of transactions simultaneously through the sales pipeline
  • Manage and track customer and transactional information in a CRM system
  • Coordinate resources throughout the sales cycle, including product support and sales engineering
  • Provide product demonstrations and general support to prospective customers
  • Nurture and expand the company’s relationship with customer accounts of all sizes
  • Provide regular reporting of pipeline and forecast through the CRM system
  • Keep abreast of competition, competitive issues and products
  • Practice effective, excellent communication with management, customers and support staff
  • Participate in team‐building and company‐growth activities including strategy setting, sales training, marketing efforts and customer care.
  • Travel to customer locations in support of sales efforts.


Who You Are…
  • Experienced. 12 or more years in enterprise software sales including missionary selling, conceptual selling and solution selling experience.
  • Amazing Salesperson. You have a desire, even an obsession, to bring new customers into the Tableau franchise and maximize revenue. You are a closer.
  • Conviction and Commitment. You have an unshakable belief that Tableau’s products will improve the world – one person at a time. Once you get it, you go all the way.
  • Excellent Communication. You know what to say and more importantly, how to say it.
  • Performer. Consistent overachievement of sales goals in a large geographic territory.
  • Relentlessly High Standards. You’re not satisfied with the status quo. You thrill in your accomplishments but also know it’s about doing and improving.
  • Missionary. Highly driven individual with an execution focus and a strong sense of urgency and a belief in Tableau’s mission.
  • Strong communication and presentation skills. You love the idea of sharing the Tableau story.
  • Go-Getter. Willing to go the extra mile with a strong work ethic; self-directed and resourceful.
  • You are a Recruiter! Tableau hires company builders and, in this role, you will be asked to be on the constant lookout for the best talent to bring onboard to help us continue to build one of the best companies in the world!

Industry

  • Information Technology and Services

Full-time

 This role will be a standalone Generalist opportunity and will not have any direct reports however will report into the Director of Corporate Services.   • Current WWCC, First Aid, Asthma, Anaphylaxis and CPR.
  • A high-level understanding of the Early Years Framework and National Quality Standards.
  • Previous assistant educator experience.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • A bright, friendly and energetic personality
  • 2x Referees (previous managers)


Benefits
  • Onsite Parking
  • Yearly staff conference.
  • Fun, vibrant team with a wonderful culture.
  • Professional Development and career advancement opportunities.

For a confidential discussion about this and our other current roles in Melbourne, call Jessica Abrill on 03-9828 6565.

Workplace Relations Lawyer and Senior Lawyer

Company Name Moores Company Location 5 Burwood Road , Hawthorn, VIC 3122, AU

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 21 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Workplace Relations Lawyer and Senior Lawyer for mid-tier firm


  • Lawyer and senior lawyer roles (2 – 10 years PQE)

  • Thriving mid-tier law firm with 80 staff

  • Cutting edge work and unique market offering

  • No billable hours – free yourself from the time sheet!

  • New premises in Hawthorn

  • Opportunity to grow and develop your practice

  • Partner with commercial and NFP clients who truly value you


Looking for fast progression based on merit? Want to be mentored by award winning Practice Leaders who will invest in fast-tracking your development? Seeking challenging and rewarding work for sophisticated and ethical clients?


If the idea of pricing matters up front and being part of a collegiate team working on quality matters without sacrificing your personal life is appealing then, we have an opportunity for you at Moores.


Moores is a thriving mid-tier law form that is looking for a lawyer and senior lawyer to join its high performing workplace relations team. \xa0

\xa0

The Position

You will work closely with accredited experts and award winning Practice Leaders providing legal and strategic advice on a broad range of employment, anti-discrimination, occupational health and safety, child safety and industrial relations matters.

Working with commercial and NFP clients in the disability, education, housing, health and NFP sectors, your matters will include:

  • advising and representing employers in workplace relations matters in commissions, courts and tribunals;
  • advising employers upon all workplace relations, whistleblowing and privacy matters;
  • advising and representing employers in workplace bargaining;
  • providing advice on preventing child abuse and elder abuse;
  • responding to Royal Commissions; and
  • advising upon executive remuneration and conditions.


The practice is highly regarded for its innovative, proactive and pragmatic approach to workplace issues. Our strength is in developing a strong understanding of client needs and providing commercial and solution-oriented advice.

\xa0

This is an opportunity to work on engaging matters, knowing you are contributing to the positive social impact of some of our ethically minded clients.

\xa0

Recent changes in the team also mean that there is an exceptional opportunity for driven and ambitious lawyers to:

  • shape the practice that they want to be a part of – encouraged to work for clients you that are a great fit for you and Moores;
  • develop niche areas of expertise that you are passionate about; and
  • progress quickly, based on merit.


The positions are full-time, however requests for flexible and part time work will be considered.


If you are looking for an exciting opportunity to hone your skills on challenging work with a fantastic firm and have a flexible, balanced lifestyle, click on the APPLY FOR THIS POSITION button below.


For further information contact Joelle Blackburn, Manager People & Culture (03)98430415.

\xa0

Candidates must have the right to live and work in Australia.

\xa0
